match.title: 9th Match Group A
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 5 wickets (with 16 balls remaining)

image.caption: A general view of Cardiff
image.longCaption: A general view of Cardiff, England v Australia, 1st Test, Cardiff, 5th day, July 12, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 10:30 start, First Session 10:30-14:00 Interval 14:00-14:45, Second Session 14:45-18:15

dismissalText.long: c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed 63 (82b 6x4 0x6 106m) SR: 76.82

dismissalComment.html: good adjustment from Taskin. Taylor goes for a premeditated ramp over fine leg, but he's shuffled across too early. Taskin sees him and digs this back of a length. He makes it a legcutter too. Taylor completely done for timing and is in a pretty poor position. Can only offer this to short fine

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson run out (Shakib Al Hasan/Mosaddek Hossain) 57 (69b 5x4 0x6 95m) SR: 82.6

dismissalComment.html: A mix-up between the wickets! This is messy, and Williamson is caught short at the bowler's end. Reward for Bangladesh after building up pressure. This was full and straight, tickled to short fine leg. Mosaddek swoops down on the ball but the throw is off-radar. Shakib adjusts, swivels around, and takes the bails off to dismiss Williamson. Shakib made that throw look a lot better. It was the captain's call, but there wasn't a run in it. Taylor wasn't interested at all. To simply put it: Williamson ran himself out

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gotcha! Good length, flat, straight, nothing out of the ordinary. Broom steps out, makes a bit of room and looks to slog this over the midwicket boundary. A nice, thick leading edge hands behind square on the off side and the fielders hold their cool. Backward point is given the pleasure, and he makes no mistake

Anderson is trapped on the back leg and he's walking off, but Neesham's called him back. We have a review for lbw. This is pushed through from around the wicket and Anderson is caught on the flick. It hit him in front of leg stump, so the review was warranted given the angle. But Anderson was deep enough for that to be a straightforward decision in the end

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: no need to appeal this time! Neesham is a fair way down the wicket. This is another routine flat ball at a length from Mosaddek. It's slightly outside off stump. The batsman runs down the track and is too late bringing his flat-batted shot down at this. It slides under his shot and the stumping is simple

breakthrough! Ronchi mistimes again. Taskin's pace is the reason. This is back of a length at off stump, and he wants to swipe this through midwicket with no intention of keeping it down. But that comes on quick, gets him high on the bat, and it's a simple lob to mid-on

good adjustment from Taskin. Taylor goes for a premeditated ramp over fine leg, but he's shuffled across too early. Taskin sees him and digs this back of a length. He makes it a legcutter too. Taylor completely done for timing and is in a pretty poor position. Can only offer this to short fine

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed 16 (18b 2x4 0x6 33m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: breakthrough! Ronchi mistimes again. Taskin's pace is the reason. This is back of a length at off stump, and he wants to swipe this through midwicket with no intention of keeping it down. But that comes on quick, gets him high on the bat, and it's a simple lob to mid-on

dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill lbw b Rubel Hossain 33 (35b 4x4 1x6 61m) SR: 94.28

dismissalComment.html: he's gone! Dead straight and probably crashing into middle stump. Good length, aimed for off stump, but comes in with his natural angle. Guptill plays down the wrong line and is well beaten for pace. A short mid-pitch discussion with his captain, and they won't review. Great bowling

dismissalText.long: st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mosaddek Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: James Neesham st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mosaddek Hossain 23 (24b 3x4 0x6 34m) SR: 95.83

dismissalComment.html: no need to appeal this time! Neesham is a fair way down the wicket. This is another routine flat ball at a length from Mosaddek. It's slightly outside off stump. The batsman runs down the track and is too late bringing his flat-batted shot down at this. It slides under his shot and the stumping is simple

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Adam Milne b Mustafizur Rahman 7 (8b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: delicious. One pacer to another. Milne shuffles across, gets a yorker and his bat can't stop that from crashing into the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Boult 114 (115b 11x4 1x6 184m) SR: 99.13

dismissalComment.html: Shakib swings... and misses. The stumps are rattled but Bangladesh are all but home. Full on off and middle, he backs away outside leg, looks to smack it away but loses his shape and his off stump. The record 224-run stand is over. Crumbs of consolation for NZ

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah not out 102 (107b 8x4 2x6 158m) SR: 95.32

dismissalComment.html: Southee strikes with his second ball. Tamim has been given out lbw by umpire Gould. The batsman chooses to challenge the on-field out decision. But this looks pretty adjacent. This was full on middle, lateral movement now, this swings in slightly, enough to bother the left-hander. Tamim falls across, plays down the wrong line. The tracker returns three reds - it would have carried onto hit the leg stump. Bangladesh's gun batsman gone for a duck

Sabbir has nicked off. Another cracker, this time from Southee. Good length, angled in, and seams away slightly, not sharply, outside off. Sabbir hangs his bat out in the channel with his feet stapled to the crease, thin-edges it behind to Ronchi, who pouches it. Some start from NZ's new-ball bowlers

inducker, Sarkar pinned on the back pad and is given! New Zealand's seamers have made short work of Bangladesh's top order. On a good length and skids back in, Sarkar is too late onto it. Southee raps the back thigh in front of middle and leg. Was it bouncing over? The tracker suggests so

Shakib swings... and misses. The stumps are rattled but Bangladesh are all but home. Full on off and middle, he backs away outside leg, looks to smack it away but loses his shape and his off stump. The record 224-run stand is over. Crumbs of consolation for NZ

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Southee 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Southee strikes with his second ball. Tamim has been given out lbw by umpire Gould. The batsman chooses to challenge the on-field out decision. But this looks pretty adjacent. This was full on middle, lateral movement now, this swings in slightly, enough to bother the left-hander. Tamim falls across, plays down the wrong line. The tracker returns three reds - it would have carried onto hit the leg stump. Bangladesh's gun batsman gone for a duck

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Ronchi b Southee 8 (9b 2x4 0x6 12m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: Sabbir has nicked off. Another cracker, this time from Southee. Good length, angled in, and seams away slightly, not sharply, outside off. Sabbir hangs his bat out in the channel with his feet stapled to the crease, thin-edges it behind to Ronchi, who pouches it. Some start from NZ's new-ball bowlers

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar lbw b Southee 3 (13b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 23.07

dismissalComment.html: inducker, Sarkar pinned on the back pad and is given! New Zealand's seamers have made short work of Bangladesh's top order. On a good length and skids back in, Sarkar is too late onto it. Southee raps the back thigh in front of middle and leg. Was it bouncing over? The tracker suggests so

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim b Milne 14 (34b 2x4 0x6 45m) SR: 41.17

dismissalComment.html: This 146ks thunderbolt from Milne storms through the gate! The middle stump is floored. Fast bowlers simply love that sight. Good length, starts outside off, and rips back in, Mushfiq wafts at it with no feet again, pace like fire. The quick bursts through the bat-pad gap. Not a memorable birthday for Mushfiq

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Boult 114 (115b 11x4 1x6 184m) SR: 99.13

dismissalComment.html: Shakib swings... and misses. The stumps are rattled but Bangladesh are all but home. Full on off and middle, he backs away outside leg, looks to smack it away but loses his shape and his off stump. The record 224-run stand is over. Crumbs of consolation for NZ

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Bangladesh have done it! They have done it again in Cardiff! They have KO'd NZ this time. Full and outside off, reaches out with his hands and flashes it in the gap between slip and gully. Yes, the man who set it up closes it out. How fitting! Mosaddek roars after the famous win. Mahmudullah has his hands aloft in utter delight

commentPostTextItems.html: 7.50pm The tournament has sprung to life with Pakistan toppling SA, SL toppling India, and Bangladesh knocking out New Zealand. Bangladesh, though, will be knocked out if Australia beat England. Bangladesh could sneak in if it's a washout tomorrow (by virtue of more wins). Today was fun. Hope you enjoyed the coverage as much as we did bringing it to you. I will leave you with some magic from Isam and Sid Monga: Red sun rising. Until next time, goodbye and good night from myself, Varun, and Raghav.

7.30pm Unbridled joy for Bangladesh, agony for New Zealand. The camera pans out to the victorious captain - Mashrafe repeatedly punches the air in delight. Mashrafe, now Bangladesh's captain, was 21 years old when Bangladesh toppled Australia in Cardiff 12 years ago. Ashraful was the architect of that epic win. Shakib and Mahmudullah now. Bangladesh's players take a lap of honour and acknowledge their fans. Great scenes in Cardiff!

What makes this sweeter is that they have won it from the depths of 33 for 4. Their big gun Tamim was swung out for a duck. Sarkar, Sabbir, and Mushfiq, the birthday boy, also departed cheaply. Mahmudullah and Shakib then responded with a massive 224-run stand - the highest ever for any wicket for Bangladesh in ODI cricket. Shakib was bowled with his side nine away from victory, but Mossadek, who had stifled New Zealand with three wickets in the slog overs in the first innings, sealed the deal.

Mashrafe: It is a great feeling. Both times I have been here. I still remember 2005 against Australia and now against New Zealand. Overall, we are very much satisfied. First match we were not up to the mark with the ball. Today, the bowlers hit the right areas. Mosaddek's three wickets was crucial. Neesham and Corey got out to him in New Zealand. Once the left-hander came, I went to the offspinner. The way Shakib and Mahmudullah batted was out of the world for me. We had the confidence once we beat New Zealand in Ireland. We are feeling great right now.

Williamson: To be fair, we thought that was a scrappy total to get. The boys were outstanding with the new ball, but saying that it was a long way away from a perfect performance. The partnership under Shakib and Mahmudullah under pressure was outstanding. 285-290 would have been a par total. Bangladesh now have a chance to make the semi-final.

Mahmudullah: I think the best part was we did not talk too much. We were just batting and just wanted to be positive. Early on it was swinging. Once it stopped swinging, it was easier to bat on. I think Tamim batted superbly in his tournament. Losing him early on was a bit of a shock. Shakib and me just wanted to hit the gaps and put the bad balls away.

Shakib, Man of the Match: As Mahmudullah said we did not talk. We did not want to chase that down. We just wanted to bat 40 overs and see where we were. Winning a match in a ICC tournament in a big thing. From hereon, we can only go forward.
Ben: "Just imagine the scenes in Dhaka and Chittagong..."
gautam: "the fact that no one has called this win against the world cup finalists an 'upset' yet shows how much bangladesh has evolved"
Aquil: "Two icebergs finally sink the BLACK CAPS titanic"
giri: "That partnership reminded me of yuvi/kaif in natwest final. Well done Bangladesh. Well deserved"

commentTextItems.html: back of a length and outside off, guided to gully

commentPreTextItems.html: Mahmudullah two shy of three figures

commentTextItems.html: Mahmudullah raises his hundred with a boundary. This almost cleared the long boundary. He celebrates the milestone with the sajdah. Not sure how I can describe this gesture. He points to his bat repeatedly and looks at the dressing room. Back of a length on the leg stump, launched over square leg

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: length and angled across off, steered straight to third man. Just one
full-toss, angling away outside off, carves it to the right of deep third man for two

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Boult 114 (115b 11x4 1x6 184m) SR: 99.13

commentTextItems.html: Shakib swings... and misses. The stumps are rattled but Bangladesh are all but home. Full on off and middle, he backs away outside leg, looks to smack it away but loses his shape and his off stump. The record 224-run stand is over. Crumbs of consolation for NZ

commentPostTextItems.html: Here is Mosaddek. Can the man who set it up sew it up for Bangladesh?

commentTextItems.html: Shakib steps away outside leg again, Boult does not chase him now. Instead puts it short and wide outside off. This is flat-batted fiercely through the covers
Shakib backs away outside leg, the bowler follows him. Shakib belts it towards the sightscreen. What a shot
full on off, drilled to mid-off for one more

There it is! A famous hundred for Shakib Al Hasan. Hundred under pressure. Banged in short on leg stump, chest-high ball, he just helps it over fine on the leg side. It goes all the way. Fitting way to raise the milestone
full and angled in on leg, tickled away fine. Mahmudullah hunts for two but Shakib sends him back. Given as leg bye

commentPostTextItems.html: Chants of "one more run! one more run"! rings around Cardiff

commentPreTextItems.html: The field has been whisked in

commentTextItems.html: short and wide outside off, flayed straight to backward point
full and outside off, opens the face, taps it to point. Shakib moves onto 99

commentPreTextItems.html: Nayeem: "This man Mahmudullah always plays well in crunch games, always a dependable batsman for Bangladesh, yet he sometimes finds his place in the team in jeopardy, recently he lost his place from the test team, what a pity for him! " --- Williamson slowing things down. Taking time to set his fields. Milne runs in from around the wicket. Loses his footing. Boos from the Bangladesh fans in Cardiff

commentTextItems.html: full on the stumps, not a yorker, played back to the bowler

commentPostTextItems.html: Siddharth: "One of the rare partnerships I've seen where both the batsmen are dominating the bowling equally well. There is no one batsman outplaying the other..There is no one batsman playing a second fiddle to the other. Brilliant by these two. Brilliant by Bangladesh"

commentTextItems.html: short and outside off, short-armed away to deep square leg

commentPostTextItems.html: Aimee: "What an amazing Birthday gift by these two for Mushfiqur :)"

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: short and really wide outside off. Shakib throws his bat at the ball... and misses
Shakib steps away outside leg again, this is short and hurled at his head, sails over it and the hook
Shakib steps away outside leg, this is pretty full at off, full enough for Shakib to get under it and launch it over mid-off who is inside the circle. Quality shot. Quality innings
slower ball around off, dabbed wide of backward point
very full and slanted down leg, another wide

headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gotcha! Good length, flat, straight, nothing out of the ordinary. Broom steps out, makes a bit of room and looks to slog this over the midwicket boundary. A nice, thick leading edge hands behind square on the off side and the fielders hold their cool. Backward point is given the pleasure, and he makes no mistake

Anderson is trapped on the back leg and he's walking off, but Neesham's called him back. We have a review for lbw. This is pushed through from around the wicket and Anderson is caught on the flick. It hit him in front of leg stump, so the review was warranted given the angle. But Anderson was deep enough for that to be a straightforward decision in the end

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: no need to appeal this time! Neesham is a fair way down the wicket. This is another routine flat ball at a length from Mosaddek. It's slightly outside off stump. The batsman runs down the track and is too late bringing his flat-batted shot down at this. It slides under his shot and the stumping is simple

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed 16 (18b 2x4 0x6 33m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: breakthrough! Ronchi mistimes again. Taskin's pace is the reason. This is back of a length at off stump, and he wants to swipe this through midwicket with no intention of keeping it down. But that comes on quick, gets him high on the bat, and it's a simple lob to mid-on

dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill lbw b Rubel Hossain 33 (35b 4x4 1x6 61m) SR: 94.28

dismissalComment.html: he's gone! Dead straight and probably crashing into middle stump. Good length, aimed for off stump, but comes in with his natural angle. Guptill plays down the wrong line and is well beaten for pace. A short mid-pitch discussion with his captain, and they won't review. Great bowling

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson run out (Shakib Al Hasan/Mosaddek Hossain) 57 (69b 5x4 0x6 95m) SR: 82.6

dismissalComment.html: A mix-up between the wickets! This is messy, and Williamson is caught short at the bowler's end. Reward for Bangladesh after building up pressure. This was full and straight, tickled to short fine leg. Mosaddek swoops down on the ball but the throw is off-radar. Shakib adjusts, swivels around, and takes the bails off to dismiss Williamson. Shakib made that throw look a lot better. It was the captain's call, but there wasn't a run in it. Taylor wasn't interested at all. To simply put it: Williamson ran himself out

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed 63 (82b 6x4 0x6 106m) SR: 76.82

dismissalComment.html: good adjustment from Taskin. Taylor goes for a premeditated ramp over fine leg, but he's shuffled across too early. Taskin sees him and digs this back of a length. He makes it a legcutter too. Taylor completely done for timing and is in a pretty poor position. Can only offer this to short fine

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Mosaddek Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Neil Broom c Tamim Iqbal b Mosaddek Hossain 36 (40b 3x4 0x6 60m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: gotcha! Good length, flat, straight, nothing out of the ordinary. Broom steps out, makes a bit of room and looks to slog this over the midwicket boundary. A nice, thick leading edge hands behind square on the off side and the fielders hold their cool. Backward point is given the pleasure, and he makes no mistake

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Corey Anderson lbw b Mosaddek Hossain 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Anderson is trapped on the back leg and he's walking off, but Neesham's called him back. We have a review for lbw. This is pushed through from around the wicket and Anderson is caught on the flick. It hit him in front of leg stump, so the review was warranted given the angle. But Anderson was deep enough for that to be a straightforward decision in the end

headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mosaddek Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: James Neesham st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mosaddek Hossain 23 (24b 3x4 0x6 34m) SR: 95.83

dismissalComment.html: no need to appeal this time! Neesham is a fair way down the wicket. This is another routine flat ball at a length from Mosaddek. It's slightly outside off stump. The batsman runs down the track and is too late bringing his flat-batted shot down at this. It slides under his shot and the stumping is simple

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Adam Milne b Mustafizur Rahman 7 (8b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: delicious. One pacer to another. Milne shuffles across, gets a yorker and his bat can't stop that from crashing into the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Southee 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Southee strikes with his second ball. Tamim has been given out lbw by umpire Gould. The batsman chooses to challenge the on-field out decision. But this looks pretty adjacent. This was full on middle, lateral movement now, this swings in slightly, enough to bother the left-hander. Tamim falls across, plays down the wrong line. The tracker returns three reds - it would have carried onto hit the leg stump. Bangladesh's gun batsman gone for a duck

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar lbw b Southee 3 (13b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 23.07

dismissalComment.html: inducker, Sarkar pinned on the back pad and is given! New Zealand's seamers have made short work of Bangladesh's top order. On a good length and skids back in, Sarkar is too late onto it. Southee raps the back thigh in front of middle and leg. Was it bouncing over? The tracker suggests so

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Ronchi b Southee 8 (9b 2x4 0x6 12m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: Sabbir has nicked off. Another cracker, this time from Southee. Good length, angled in, and seams away slightly, not sharply, outside off. Sabbir hangs his bat out in the channel with his feet stapled to the crease, thin-edges it behind to Ronchi, who pouches it. Some start from NZ's new-ball bowlers

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim b Milne 14 (34b 2x4 0x6 45m) SR: 41.17

dismissalComment.html: This 146ks thunderbolt from Milne storms through the gate! The middle stump is floored. Fast bowlers simply love that sight. Good length, starts outside off, and rips back in, Mushfiq wafts at it with no feet again, pace like fire. The quick bursts through the bat-pad gap. Not a memorable birthday for Mushfiq

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Boult 114 (115b 11x4 1x6 184m) SR: 99.13

dismissalComment.html: Shakib swings... and misses. The stumps are rattled but Bangladesh are all but home. Full on off and middle, he backs away outside leg, looks to smack it away but loses his shape and his off stump. The record 224-run stand is over. Crumbs of consolation for NZ

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah not out 102 (107b 8x4 2x6 158m) SR: 95.32

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

milestones.description: Mahmudullah and Shakib's 224-run partnership is BAN's highest for the 5th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 148 between Mushfiqur and Shakib
Mahmudullah and Shakib's 224-run partnership is BAN's highest for any wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 178 between Tamim Iqbal and Mushfiqur
Ross Taylor has scored 54 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for NZ breaking Nathan Astle's record
Mortaza has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (176) for BAN, going past Ashraful

stories.title: Bangladesh hold nerve to produce another statement win
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, Champions Trophy, Group A, Cardiff
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh hold nerve to produce another statement win
stories.summary: Bangladesh returned to the scene of one of their finest hours, and the occasion brought out the best in two players who have been pivotal to their rise

stories.title: 'World cricket clichs overturned'
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, Champions Trophy, Group A, Cardiff

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah have a chat during their partnership
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah have a chat during their partnership, New Zealand v Bangladesh, Group A, Champions Trophy 2017, Cardiff, June 9, 2017

stories.title: Mahmudullah unveils another big-match classic
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, Champions Trophy, Group A, Cardiff
stories.summary: Walking in at 33 for 4 in a chase of 266, Mahmudullah harnessed all his skills of technique and temperament to compile his third ODI hundred and partner Shakib Al Hasan in Bangladesh's biggest, and greatest, partnership in the format

image.caption: Mahmudullah showed his range
image.longCaption: Mahmudullah showed his range, New Zealand v Bangladesh, Group A, Champions Trophy 2017, Cardiff, June 9, 2017

stories.title: Record-breaking Shakib and Mahmudullah stun New Zealand
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, Champions Trophy, Group A, Cardiff
stories.seoTitle: Record-breaking Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah stun New Zealand
stories.summary: Bangladesh scripted a stunning turnaround through centurions Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah, who put on the highest partnership for any wicket in ODIs for their team, in a five-wicket win over New Zealand

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah have a chat during their partnership
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah have a chat during their partnership, New Zealand v Bangladesh, Group A, Champions Trophy 2017, Cardiff, June 9, 2017

stories.title: 'Cannot focus only on Williamson' - Mashrafe
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, Group A, Cardiff
stories.summary: The Bangladesh captain accepted luck played a role in them earning one point against Australia but said that his players were excited at the prospect of having an outside chance of getting a semi-final spot

image.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza reacts in the field
image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza reacts in the field, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Dambulla, March 25, 2017

stories.title: Winner stays in the race, loser goes home
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, Champions Trophy, Group A, Cardiff
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v NZ: Winner stays in the race, loser goes home
stories.summary: The equation is simple ahead of the New Zealand-Bangladesh game: the winner will remain in contention for a semi-final spot, if England beat Australia or their match is washed out

stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, Champions Trophy, Group A, Cardiff
stories.seoTitle: New Zealand still trying to fill the shoes of 2015 World Cup heroes
stories.summary: Halfway between World Cups, New Zealand remain in search of an XI that shores up holes left by 2015 linchpins Brendon McCullum, Daniel Vettori and Grant Elliott

image.caption: Kane Williamson is dejected after New Zealand are knocked out
image.longCaption: Kane Williamson is dejected after New Zealand are knocked out, New Zealand v Bangladesh, Group A, Champions Trophy 2017, Cardiff, June 9, 2017

stories.title: Bangladesh hold nerve to produce another statement win
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, Champions Trophy, Group A, Cardiff
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh hold nerve to produce another statement win
stories.summary: Bangladesh returned to the scene of one of their finest hours, and the occasion brought out the best in two players who have been pivotal to their rise

image.caption: Mahmudullah and Mosaddek Hossain exult after Bangladesh's win
image.longCaption: Mahmudullah and Mosaddek Hossain exult after Bangladesh's win, New Zealand v Bangladesh, Group A, Champions Trophy 2017, Cardiff, June 9, 2017

videos.title: Champion of the match - Mahmudullah
videos.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, Champions Trophy, Group A, Cardiff
videos.summary: A third century in ICC tournaments from Mahmudullah saw him, along with Shakib Al Hasan, take Bangladesh home against New Zealand in Cardiff

videos.title: Fleming: Class and determination from Shakib
videos.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, Champions Trophy, Group A, Cardiff
videos.seoTitle: Fleming: Class and determination from Shakib
videos.summary: Shakib Al Hasan came roaring back into form with a century against New Zealand to keep Bangladesh's hopes alive in the Champions Trophy

videos.title: Tait: Taskin selection paid off
videos.subTitle: NZ V BAN, CHAMPIONS TROPHY, GROUP A, CARDIFF
videos.summary: Some brave selection calls and on-field tactics helped Bangladesh register a famous win over New Zealand in Champions Trophy 2017

recentReportStory.title: Record-breaking Shakib and Mahmudullah stun New Zealand
recentReportStory.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, Champions Trophy, Group A, Cardiff
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Record-breaking Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah stun New Zealand
recentReportStory.summary: Bangladesh scripted a stunning turnaround through centurions Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah, who put on the highest partnership for any wicket in ODIs for their team, in a five-wicket win over New Zealand

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah have a chat during their partnership
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah have a chat during their partnership, New Zealand v Bangladesh, Group A, Champions Trophy 2017, Cardiff, June 9, 2017

recentReportStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. @isam84

recentPreviewStory.title: Winner stays in the race, loser goes home
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, Champions Trophy, Group A, Cardiff
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: Bangladesh v NZ: Winner stays in the race, loser goes home
recentPreviewStory.summary: The equation is simple ahead of the New Zealand-Bangladesh game: the winner will remain in contention for a semi-final spot, if England beat Australia or their match is washed out

image.caption: Kane Williamson drives elegantly
image.longCaption: Kane Williamson drives elegantly, Australia v New Zealand, Champions Trophy, Group A, Edgbaston, June 2, 2017

recentPreviewStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. @isam84
